CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 3, 1946, pg. 27, reads: "Producing 'Water Circus' - It takes a lot of work to put on a big water show and the four men pictured here are conferring on some of the featured acts in exhibition to be presented at Ammon Center next Friday night. The 'Circus' will be one of the features of Frog Week and a cast of more than fifty people will participate.  The directors are, left to right: Pomeroyal Fountain, physical director of the Centre Avenue YMCA; Nate Kaufman of the Honus Wager Sporting Goods Store; James Dorsey, director of Ammon Centre, and Emil Bonavita of the American Red Cross staff.  The 'Circus' will be free to everyone and is being sponsored by the Frogs and the Bureau of Recreation. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of directors of FROGS week production "Water Circus," from left: Pomeroyal Fountain, Nate Kaufman, James Dorsey, and Emil Bonavita, at Ammon Recreation Center
